texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: KOFI ANNAN CENTRE OF EXCELLENCE IN ICT BILL, 2025
texts.text: KOFI ANNAN CENTRE OF EXCELLENCE IN ICT BILL, 2025

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An Act to establish the Kofi Annan Centre of Excellence in ICT as a centre of Excellence in Information and  Communication Technology dedicated to advancing research, innovation, and capacity building, as well as providing consultancy and advisory services in ICT, Emerging Digital Technologies, and related areas.
texts.text: An Act to establish the Kofi Annan Centre of Excellence in ICT as a centre of Excellence in Information and  Communication Technology dedicated to advancing research, innovation, and capacity building, as well as providing consultancy and advisory services in ICT, Emerging Digital Technologies, and related areas.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: PASSED by Parliament on ................ and assented to by the President.
texts.text: PASSED by Parliament on ................ and assented to by the President.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Establishment of the Kofi Annan Research and Development Centre
texts.text: Establishment of the Kofi Annan Research and Development Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. (1) There is established by this Act the Kofi Annan Centre of Excellence in ICT.
texts.text: (1) There is established by this Act the Kofi Annan Centre of Excellence in ICT.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Centre shall be a body corporate with perpetual succession and a common seal, may sue and be sued in its corporate name.
texts.text: The Centre shall be a body corporate with perpetual succession and a common seal, may sue and be sued in its corporate name.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Centre shall for the performance of its functions have the right to acquire and hold  movable  and  immovable  property  and  enter  into  a  contract  or  any  other transaction.
texts.text: The Centre shall for the performance of its functions have the right to acquire and hold  movable  and  immovable  property  and  enter  into  a  contract  or  any  other transaction.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  Where  there  is  a  hindrance  to  the  acquisition  of  property,  the  property  may  be acquired for the Centre under the Land Act, 2020 (Act 1036) and the cost shall be borne by the Centre.
texts.text: Where  there  is  a  hindrance  to  the  acquisition  of  property,  the  property  may  be acquired for the Centre under the Land Act, 2020 (Act 1036) and the cost shall be borne by the Centre.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2. Object of the Centre
texts.text: 2. Object of the Centre

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The object of the  Centre is to serve as the  Centre of Excellence dedicated to advancing research, development, innovation, and capacity building, as well as providing consultancy and advisory services in emerging digital technologies and related fields in ICT.
texts.text: The object of the  Centre is to serve as the  Centre of Excellence dedicated to advancing research, development, innovation, and capacity building, as well as providing consultancy and advisory services in emerging digital technologies and related fields in ICT.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Functions of the Centre
texts.text: Functions of the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. 1) To achieve the object, the Centre shall:
texts.text: 1) To achieve the object, the Centre shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) undertake research, development, training and consultancy in ICT;
texts.text: undertake research, development, training and consultancy in ICT;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) grant no objections to public institutions seeking to apply for public funding in ICT research, subject to fulfilment of application requirements;
texts.text: grant no objections to public institutions seeking to apply for public funding in ICT research, subject to fulfilment of application requirements;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) collaborate with international organisations on matters of research and development in  ICT and emerging digital technologies;
texts.text: collaborate with international organisations on matters of research and development in  ICT and emerging digital technologies;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) provide education and training in ICT to public institutions;
texts.text: provide education and training in ICT to public institutions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) provide consultancy and advisory services in ICT to support public and private sector initiatives;
texts.text: provide consultancy and advisory services in ICT to support public and private sector initiatives;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f) represent  Ghana  in  regional  and  global  forums  and  foster  cross  border  digital  cooperation in ICT;
texts.text: represent  Ghana  in  regional  and  global  forums  and  foster  cross  border  digital  cooperation in ICT;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g)  promote digital inclusion and equitable access to infrastructure and services across Ghana through research, advocacy, training, capacity development, coaching and
texts.text: promote digital inclusion and equitable access to infrastructure and services across Ghana through research, advocacy, training, capacity development, coaching and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: mentorship in ICT;
texts.text: mentorship in ICT;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: h)  develop  and  promote  standards,  best  practices  and  frameworks  in  software  and hardware development in ICT;
texts.text: develop  and  promote  standards,  best  practices  and  frameworks  in  software  and hardware development in ICT;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i) monitor and evaluate the impact of ICT projects and grant funded initiatives to ensure alignment with national goals in ICT; and
texts.text: monitor and evaluate the impact of ICT projects and grant funded initiatives to ensure alignment with national goals in ICT; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: j) perform any other functions ancillary to the objects of the Centre.
texts.text: perform any other functions ancillary to the objects of the Centre.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Powers of the Centre
texts.text: Powers of the Centre

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: National ICT Research and Development Mandate
texts.text: National ICT Research and Development Mandate

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. (1)  The  Centre  is  hereby  designated  as  the  National  Centre  for  Research  and Development in ICT, in Ghana.
texts.text: (1)  The  Centre  is  hereby  designated  as  the  National  Centre  for  Research  and Development in ICT, in Ghana.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Centre shall;
texts.text: The Centre shall;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) serve  as  the  primary  institution  for  coordinating  research  and  development initiatives in ICT in the public sector;
texts.text: serve  as  the  primary  institution  for  coordinating  research  and  development initiatives in ICT in the public sector;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) be the national institution for attracting and managing public funding and technical support in ICT research and development from bilateral and multilateral partners, philanthropic foundations, and other international bodies; and
texts.text: be the national institution for attracting and managing public funding and technical support in ICT research and development from bilateral and multilateral partners, philanthropic foundations, and other international bodies; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) provide  support  to  public  and  private  sectors  engaged  in  digital  innovation  and research.
texts.text: provide  support  to  public  and  private  sectors  engaged  in  digital  innovation  and research.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Mandatory Consultation for ICT Training
texts.text: Mandatory Consultation for ICT Training

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. (1) The Centre shall serve as the primary national body for the provision, coordination, and standardization of ICT training for public sector institutions in Ghana.
texts.text: (1) The Centre shall serve as the primary national body for the provision, coordination, and standardization of ICT training for public sector institutions in Ghana.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  All ministries, departments, agencies, metropolitan, municipal and district assemblies, statutory bodies, public corporations, and other state institutions intending to undertake ICT training for their personnel shall first consult the Centre regarding the availability and capacity to provide the required training.
texts.text: All ministries, departments, agencies, metropolitan, municipal and district assemblies, statutory bodies, public corporations, and other state institutions intending to undertake ICT training for their personnel shall first consult the Centre regarding the availability and capacity to provide the required training.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  Where the Centre confirms that it has the capacity to deliver the requested training, the institution shall procure such training from the Centre.
texts.text: Where the Centre confirms that it has the capacity to deliver the requested training, the institution shall procure such training from the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  Where the Centre determines that it does not have the capacity to provide the training in whole or in part, the institution may procure such training from an alternative provider, subject to any guidance or standards issued by the Centre.
texts.text: Where the Centre determines that it does not have the capacity to provide the training in whole or in part, the institution may procure such training from an alternative provider, subject to any guidance or standards issued by the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  Any institution, referred to under section 5(2) that procures ICT training without prior consultation  with  the  Centre,  or  contrary  to  the  Centre's  determination  under  this section,  shall  be  deemed  non-compliant  and  may  be  subject  to  administrative sanctions as may be prescribed by regulations.
texts.text: Any institution, referred to under section 5(2) that procures ICT training without prior consultation  with  the  Centre,  or  contrary  to  the  Centre's  determination  under  this section,  shall  be  deemed  non-compliant  and  may  be  subject  to  administrative sanctions as may be prescribed by regulations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Intermediary Role
texts.text: Intermediary Role

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. (1)  The  Centre shall serve as the national intermediary for public institutions in Ghana, responsible for receiving, assessing, coordinating, and disbursing public funding, grants, technical  assistance,  or  other  forms  of  support  from  international  and  philanthropic organizations intended to promote research, innovation, or development in ICT.
texts.text: (1)  The  Centre shall serve as the national intermediary for public institutions in Ghana, responsible for receiving, assessing, coordinating, and disbursing public funding, grants, technical  assistance,  or  other  forms  of  support  from  international  and  philanthropic organizations intended to promote research, innovation, or development in ICT.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Without limiting subsection (1), the Centre shall;
texts.text: Without limiting subsection (1), the Centre shall;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) establish  a  framework  for  the  submission  and  evaluation  of  public  funding proposals by public institutions;
texts.text: establish  a  framework  for  the  submission  and  evaluation  of  public  funding proposals by public institutions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) assess the technical, operational and financial feasibility of proposed projects of public institutions;
texts.text: assess the technical, operational and financial feasibility of proposed projects of public institutions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) act as an intermediary or fund administrator for funding to public institutions, where authorized by the funding partner; and
texts.text: act as an intermediary or fund administrator for funding to public institutions, where authorized by the funding partner; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) monitor and report on the implementation and impact of projects financed through public funding.
texts.text: monitor and report on the implementation and impact of projects financed through public funding.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A  funding  agency, development  partner  or  international  donor  may  enter  into  an agreement with the Centre for the purposes of administering, disbursing or managing public funding in accordance with this section.
texts.text: A  funding  agency, development  partner  or  international  donor  may  enter  into  an agreement with the Centre for the purposes of administering, disbursing or managing public funding in accordance with this section.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: No Objection by the Centre
texts.text: No Objection by the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. (1) A public institution who seeks to apply for, receive, administer or benefit from public funding from any local or international source for research or development project in ICT, shall, prior to applying for such funding, obtain a no objection from the Centre.
texts.text: (1) A public institution who seeks to apply for, receive, administer or benefit from public funding from any local or international source for research or development project in ICT, shall, prior to applying for such funding, obtain a no objection from the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The application shall be in writing and shall be accompanied by;
texts.text: The application shall be in writing and shall be accompanied by;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) such documents as shall be prescribed by regulations made pursuant to this Act; and
texts.text: such documents as shall be prescribed by regulations made pursuant to this Act; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) prescribed fees.
texts.text: prescribed fees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Centre  shall keep  a  repository of public institutions  and research  and development projects certified under section 7 of this Act.
texts.text: The Centre  shall keep  a  repository of public institutions  and research  and development projects certified under section 7 of this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The Centre shall issue a no objection where it is satisfied that;
texts.text: The Centre shall issue a no objection where it is satisfied that;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) the proposed research and development project is legitimate and aligned with the national development goals in ICT;
texts.text: the proposed research and development project is legitimate and aligned with the national development goals in ICT;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) the public institution possesses the requisite capacity to execute the proposed research and development project; and
texts.text: the public institution possesses the requisite capacity to execute the proposed research and development project; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) the  implementation and governance framework of the proposed research and development project meets the standards prescribed by the Centre.
texts.text: the  implementation and governance framework of the proposed research and development project meets the standards prescribed by the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  A no objection granted under this section;
texts.text: A no objection granted under this section;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) shall be valid only for the specific the proposed research and development project for which it is issued;
texts.text: shall be valid only for the specific the proposed research and development project for which it is issued;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) shall not be transferrable;
texts.text: shall not be transferrable;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) shall  not  constitute  a  general  endorsement  of  the  public  institution's  other activities; and
texts.text: shall  not  constitute  a  general  endorsement  of  the  public  institution's  other activities; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) may be subject to such conditions as the Centre may prescribe.
texts.text: may be subject to such conditions as the Centre may prescribe.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6) A public institution who;
texts.text: A public institution who;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) applies for, receives, or administers ICT-related public funding in contravention of section 7 of this Act; or
texts.text: applies for, receives, or administers ICT-related public funding in contravention of section 7 of this Act; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) knowingly misrepresents or omits material information in an application for no objection commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units.
texts.text: knowingly misrepresents or omits material information in an application for no objection commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7) In addition to any penalty imposed under subsection (6) the Centre may disqualify the public institution from applying for a no objection or public funding for a period not exceeding three (3) years.
texts.text: In addition to any penalty imposed under subsection (6) the Centre may disqualify the public institution from applying for a no objection or public funding for a period not exceeding three (3) years.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (8) The Centre shall, within thirty (30) days of receipt of an application for no objection inform the public institution in writing of the decision of the Centre.
texts.text: The Centre shall, within thirty (30) days of receipt of an application for no objection inform the public institution in writing of the decision of the Centre.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Review of a no objection decision of the Centre
texts.text: Review of a no objection decision of the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. (1) A public institution whose no objection application has been denied by the Centre may, within thirty 30 days of receipt of the decision, submit a complaint in writing to the Director-General for a review of the decision. The Director-General shall within thirty (30) days of receipt of the complaint, review the complaint and inform the complainant of the outcome of the review.
texts.text: (1) A public institution whose no objection application has been denied by the Centre may, within thirty 30 days of receipt of the decision, submit a complaint in writing to the Director-General for a review of the decision. The Director-General shall within thirty (30) days of receipt of the complaint, review the complaint and inform the complainant of the outcome of the review.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2)  A  public  institution  dissatisfied  with  the  decision  of  the  Director-General  under subsection (1) may, within 28 days after the date of receipt of the decision, submit a complaint in writing to the Minister for a review of the decision of the Director-General. The Minister shall within 60 days of receipt of the complaint, review the complaint and inform the complainant of a decision.
texts.text: (2)  A  public  institution  dissatisfied  with  the  decision  of  the  Director-General  under subsection (1) may, within 28 days after the date of receipt of the decision, submit a complaint in writing to the Minister for a review of the decision of the Director-General. The Minister shall within 60 days of receipt of the complaint, review the complaint and inform the complainant of a decision.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Governance of the Centre
texts.text: Governance of the Centre

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Governing Body of the Centre
texts.text: Governing Body of the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. (1)  The governing body of the Centre shall be a Governing Board consisting of;
texts.text: (1)  The governing body of the Centre shall be a Governing Board consisting of;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  The Chairperson;
texts.text: The Chairperson;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) The Director-General of the Centre;
texts.text: The Director-General of the Centre;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) One representative from the Technical, Vocational Education and Training (TVET) Service, not below the rank of a Director;
texts.text: One representative from the Technical, Vocational Education and Training (TVET) Service, not below the rank of a Director;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) One representative from the Ministry not below the rank of a Director;
texts.text: One representative from the Ministry not below the rank of a Director;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e)  Two persons in academia appointed by the Ghana Tertiary Education Commission, with expertise in ICT, not below the rank of Senior Lecturer;
texts.text: Two persons in academia appointed by the Ghana Tertiary Education Commission, with expertise in ICT, not below the rank of Senior Lecturer;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f) Two persons with expertise in ICT, nominated by their professional bodies; and
texts.text: Two persons with expertise in ICT, nominated by their professional bodies; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g) Two persons appointed by the President.
texts.text: Two persons appointed by the President.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Members of the Board shall be appointed by the President in accordance with Article 70 of the Constitution.
texts.text: Members of the Board shall be appointed by the President in accordance with Article 70 of the Constitution.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) Notwithstanding any other provision in this section, the composition of the governing board shall include not less than three (3) women as members.
texts.text: Notwithstanding any other provision in this section, the composition of the governing board shall include not less than three (3) women as members.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Functions of the Board
texts.text: Functions of the Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10. (1) The Board shall be responsible for the performance of the functions of the Centre, the drafting and implementing of operational policies, general supervision of the management and affairs of the Centre; and such other functions conferred upon it by this Act.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall be responsible for the performance of the functions of the Centre, the drafting and implementing of operational policies, general supervision of the management and affairs of the Centre; and such other functions conferred upon it by this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  For the purposes of subsection (1);
texts.text: For the purposes of subsection (1);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) establish  appropriate  structures  for  the  effective  and  efficient  execution  of  the object of the  Centre;
texts.text: establish  appropriate  structures  for  the  effective  and  efficient  execution  of  the object of the  Centre;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) secure the achievement of the object of the Centre;
texts.text: secure the achievement of the object of the Centre;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) take reasonable and timely action on the reports submitted to it by the DirectorGeneral;
texts.text: take reasonable and timely action on the reports submitted to it by the DirectorGeneral;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) advise  the  Minister  on the drafting of  legislative  instruments,  regulations and policies  for  the  effective  implementation of this Act; and
texts.text: advise  the  Minister  on the drafting of  legislative  instruments,  regulations and policies  for  the  effective  implementation of this Act; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) perform any other functions incidental to the achievement of the aims of the Centre.
texts.text: perform any other functions incidental to the achievement of the aims of the Centre.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Duties and Liabilities of members of the Board
texts.text: Duties and Liabilities of members of the Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11. (1) A member of the Board shall have the same fiduciary relationship with the Centre and the duty to act in good faith as a director of a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2019 (Act 992).
texts.text: (1) A member of the Board shall have the same fiduciary relationship with the Centre and the duty to act in good faith as a director of a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2019 (Act 992).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Without limiting subsection (1), a member of the Board has a duty;
texts.text: Without limiting subsection (1), a member of the Board has a duty;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) to act honestly in the performance of the functions of that member;
texts.text: to act honestly in the performance of the functions of that member;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) to exercise the degree of care and diligence in the performance of the functions of that  member,  that  a  reasonable  person  in  that  position  would  reasonably  be expected to exercise in the circumstances;
texts.text: to exercise the degree of care and diligence in the performance of the functions of that  member,  that  a  reasonable  person  in  that  position  would  reasonably  be expected to exercise in the circumstances;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) not  to  use  information  acquired  by  virtue  of  the  position  of  that  member  as  a member of the Board without authorization; and
texts.text: not  to  use  information  acquired  by  virtue  of  the  position  of  that  member  as  a member of the Board without authorization; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) not to use the position of the member to gain directly or indirectly, a benefit for that member or for any other person; and
texts.text: not to use the position of the member to gain directly or indirectly, a benefit for that member or for any other person; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) not to knowingly or negligently cause loss to the Centre.
texts.text: not to knowingly or negligently cause loss to the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A member of the Board who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than two thousand penalty units and not more than six thousand penalty units.
texts.text: A member of the Board who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than two thousand penalty units and not more than six thousand penalty units.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Establishment of centres, units, projects and  limited liability entities
texts.text: Establishment of centres, units, projects and  limited liability entities

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12. (1) The Board shall have the power to establish centres, units, projects and limited liability entities with appropriate structures for the effective and efficient execution of the object of the Centre.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall have the power to establish centres, units, projects and limited liability entities with appropriate structures for the effective and efficient execution of the object of the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Without  limiting  subsection  (1),  the  following  centres  established  prior  to  the commencement of this Act shall continue to operate under this Act as centres of the Centre;
texts.text: Without  limiting  subsection  (1),  the  following  centres  established  prior  to  the commencement of this Act shall continue to operate under this Act as centres of the Centre;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  Open Technologies Research and Development Centre, Bolgatanga;
texts.text: Open Technologies Research and Development Centre, Bolgatanga;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  Smart Technologies & AI Research Centre, Sunyani; and
texts.text: Smart Technologies & AI Research Centre, Sunyani; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) GI-KACE Consult Ltd.
texts.text: GI-KACE Consult Ltd.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Meetings of the Board
texts.text: Meetings of the Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 13. (1) The Board shall meet at least once every three months for the dispatch of business at a time and venue determined by the chairperson.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall meet at least once every three months for the dispatch of business at a time and venue determined by the chairperson.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  chairperson  shall  at  the  request  in  writing  of  not  less  than  one  third  of  the membership of the Board convene an extra-ordinary meeting of the Board at a place and time determined by the chairperson.
texts.text: The  chairperson  shall  at  the  request  in  writing  of  not  less  than  one  third  of  the membership of the Board convene an extra-ordinary meeting of the Board at a place and time determined by the chairperson.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The quorum at a meeting of the Board is two thirds of members of the Board or a greater number determined by the Board in respect of an important matter.
texts.text: The quorum at a meeting of the Board is two thirds of members of the Board or a greater number determined by the Board in respect of an important matter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The chairperson shall preside at the meetings of the Board and in the absence of the chairperson, a  member of the Board elected by the members present from among their number shall preside.
texts.text: The chairperson shall preside at the meetings of the Board and in the absence of the chairperson, a  member of the Board elected by the members present from among their number shall preside.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  Matters before the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and in  the event  of  an equality  of  votes,  the  person  presiding  shall  have  a casting vote.
texts.text: Matters before the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting, and in  the event  of  an equality  of  votes,  the  person  presiding  shall  have  a casting vote.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  The Board may co-opt a person to attend a Board meeting but that person shall not vote on a matter for decision at the meeting.
texts.text: The Board may co-opt a person to attend a Board meeting but that person shall not vote on a matter for decision at the meeting.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  The proceedings of the Board shall not be invalidated due to a vacancy among the members or a defect in the appointment or qualification of a member.
texts.text: The proceedings of the Board shall not be invalidated due to a vacancy among the members or a defect in the appointment or qualification of a member.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (8)  The Board shall, subject to this section, determine the procedure for its meetings.
texts.text: The Board shall, subject to this section, determine the procedure for its meetings.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Tenure of office of members of the Board
texts.text: Tenure of office of members of the Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14. ( 1) A member of the Board shall hold office for a period not exceeding four years and is eligible for re- appointment, but a member shall not be appointed for more than two terms.
texts.text: ( 1) A member of the Board shall hold office for a period not exceeding four years and is eligible for re- appointment, but a member shall not be appointed for more than two terms.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  Subsection (1) does not apply to the Director-General of the Centre.
texts.text: Subsection (1) does not apply to the Director-General of the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A member of the Board may at any time resign from office in writing addressed to the President through the Minister.
texts.text: A member of the Board may at any time resign from office in writing addressed to the President through the Minister.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  A member  of  the  Board,  other  than  the  Director-General  of  the  Centre,  who  is absent  from  three consecutive meetings of the Board without sufficient cause shall cease to be a member of the Board.
texts.text: A member  of  the  Board,  other  than  the  Director-General  of  the  Centre,  who  is absent  from  three consecutive meetings of the Board without sufficient cause shall cease to be a member of the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The President may by letter addressed to a member revoke the appointment of that member.
texts.text: The President may by letter addressed to a member revoke the appointment of that member.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  Where a member of the Board is, for a sufficient cause, unable to act as a member, the  Minister shall determine whether the inability would result in the declaration of a vacancy.
texts.text: Where a member of the Board is, for a sufficient cause, unable to act as a member, the  Minister shall determine whether the inability would result in the declaration of a vacancy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7)  Where there is a vacancy; under subsection (3), or subsection (4), or as a result of a declaration under subsection (6), or by reason of the death of a member, the Minister shall notify the President of the vacancy and the President shall appoint a person to fill the vacancy.
texts.text: Where there is a vacancy; under subsection (3), or subsection (4), or as a result of a declaration under subsection (6), or by reason of the death of a member, the Minister shall notify the President of the vacancy and the President shall appoint a person to fill the vacancy.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Disclosure of Interest
texts.text: Disclosure of Interest

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15. (1) A member of the Board who has an interest in a matter for consideration by the Board shall:
texts.text: (1) A member of the Board who has an interest in a matter for consideration by the Board shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) disclose, in writing, the nature of the interest to the Board prior to or at the meeting at which the matter is to be considered; and the disclosure shall form part of the record for the consideration of the matter; and
texts.text: disclose, in writing, the nature of the interest to the Board prior to or at the meeting at which the matter is to be considered; and the disclosure shall form part of the record for the consideration of the matter; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) not be present at nor participate in the deliberations of the Board in respect of that matter.
texts.text: not be present at nor participate in the deliberations of the Board in respect of that matter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  A member ceases to be a member of the Board, if that member has an interest in a matter before the Board but;
texts.text: A member ceases to be a member of the Board, if that member has an interest in a matter before the Board but;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) fails to disclose that interest, and
texts.text: fails to disclose that interest, and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) is present and participates in the deliberations of the matter.
texts.text: is present and participates in the deliberations of the matter.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Committees of the Board
texts.text: Committees of the Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16. (1)  The Board may establish committees consisting of members of the Board or nonmembers of the Board or both  and may assign to these committees such functions as the Board may determine.
texts.text: (1)  The Board may establish committees consisting of members of the Board or nonmembers of the Board or both  and may assign to these committees such functions as the Board may determine.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  tenure  of  office  of  a  member  of  a  committee  shall  be  coterminous  with  that member's term of office on the Board.
texts.text: The  tenure  of  office  of  a  member  of  a  committee  shall  be  coterminous  with  that member's term of office on the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A committee composed of members and non-members of the Board shall be chaired by a member of the Board.
texts.text: A committee composed of members and non-members of the Board shall be chaired by a member of the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The provisions of Section 16 on Disclosure of Interest shall apply to members of a committee of the Board.
texts.text: The provisions of Section 16 on Disclosure of Interest shall apply to members of a committee of the Board.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Allowances for members of the Board and Committees
texts.text: Allowances for members of the Board and Committees

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 17. Board members and members of committees of the Board shall be paid such allowances as are approved by the Minister in consultation with the Minister responsible for Finance.
texts.text: Board members and members of committees of the Board shall be paid such allowances as are approved by the Minister in consultation with the Minister responsible for Finance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Policy Directives
texts.text: Policy Directives

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 18. The  Minister  may  give  policy  directives  to  the  Board  in  writing,  consistent  with  the provisions of this Act and the Board shall comply.
texts.text: The  Minister  may  give  policy  directives  to  the  Board  in  writing,  consistent  with  the provisions of this Act and the Board shall comply.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Administration of the Centre
texts.text: Administration of the Centre

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Director- General of the Centre
texts.text: Director- General of the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 19. (1) The  Director-General  shall  be  appointed  by  the  President  in  accordance  with Article  195  of  the Constitution.
texts.text: (1) The  Director-General  shall  be  appointed  by  the  President  in  accordance  with Article  195  of  the Constitution.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  Director-General  shall  be  responsible  for  the  day-to-day  administration  of  the Centre and shall be accountable to the Board in the performance of his/her functions under this Act.
texts.text: The  Director-General  shall  be  responsible  for  the  day-to-day  administration  of  the Centre and shall be accountable to the Board in the performance of his/her functions under this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The  Director-General  shall,  subject  to  the  general  directives  of  the  Board,  be responsible  for  the effective management and administration of the Centre.
texts.text: The  Director-General  shall,  subject  to  the  general  directives  of  the  Board,  be responsible  for  the effective management and administration of the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The  Director-General  shall  hold  office  on  the  terms  and  conditions  specified  in his/her  letter  of appointment.
texts.text: The  Director-General  shall  hold  office  on  the  terms  and  conditions  specified  in his/her  letter  of appointment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  The Director-General may in writing, delegate a function to an officer of the Centre, except that,  such delegation  shall not  relieve  the  Director-General  of  the  ultimate responsibility for the performance of the delegated function.
texts.text: The Director-General may in writing, delegate a function to an officer of the Centre, except that,  such delegation  shall not  relieve  the  Director-General  of  the  ultimate responsibility for the performance of the delegated function.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6)  The  Director-General  shall  be  a  person  of  high  moral  character  and  integrity  with the  relevant qualifications and experience related to the functions of the Centre.
texts.text: The  Director-General  shall  be  a  person  of  high  moral  character  and  integrity  with the  relevant qualifications and experience related to the functions of the Centre.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Secretary to the Board
texts.text: Secretary to the Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 20. (1) The Board shall designate an officer of the Centre not below the rank of a Deputy Director as Secretary to the Board.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall designate an officer of the Centre not below the rank of a Deputy Director as Secretary to the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) The Secretary shall;
texts.text: The Secretary shall;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) arrange the meetings of the Board;
texts.text: arrange the meetings of the Board;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) record and maintain minutes of meetings of the Board;
texts.text: record and maintain minutes of meetings of the Board;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) record and maintain resolutions passed by the Board;
texts.text: record and maintain resolutions passed by the Board;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) maintain a Register of Board Members' Interest; and
texts.text: maintain a Register of Board Members' Interest; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) perform any other functions assigned by the Board.
texts.text: perform any other functions assigned by the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  Secretary,  in  the  performance  of  the  functions  under  subsection  (2),  shall be accountable to the Board.
texts.text: The  Secretary,  in  the  performance  of  the  functions  under  subsection  (2),  shall be accountable to the Board.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Appointment of other Staff
texts.text: Appointment of other Staff

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 21. (1) The Centre may employ such staff as may be necessary for the proper and effective performance of its functions.
texts.text: (1) The Centre may employ such staff as may be necessary for the proper and effective performance of its functions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The  Board  shall  determine  vacancies and  qualifications  of  staff  to  be  recruited  in accordance with Article  195 of the Constitution.
texts.text: The  Board  shall  determine  vacancies and  qualifications  of  staff  to  be  recruited  in accordance with Article  195 of the Constitution.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The terms, conditions and scheme of service of a person employed by the  Centre shall be as approved by the Board.
texts.text: The terms, conditions and scheme of service of a person employed by the  Centre shall be as approved by the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The  Centre  may,  on  the  recommendation  of  the  Board,  engage  the  services  of consultants and experts for the effective discharge  of the functions of the Centre.
texts.text: The  Centre  may,  on  the  recommendation  of  the  Board,  engage  the  services  of consultants and experts for the effective discharge  of the functions of the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  Other public officers may be transferred or seconded to the Centre or may otherwise provide assistance to the Centre.
texts.text: Other public officers may be transferred or seconded to the Centre or may otherwise provide assistance to the Centre.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Directorates of the Centre
texts.text: Directorates of the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22. (1) The Board may create such directorates as it may consider necessary for the efficient and effective  performance of the functions of the Centre.
texts.text: (1) The Board may create such directorates as it may consider necessary for the efficient and effective  performance of the functions of the Centre.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The directorates may include:
texts.text: The directorates may include:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a)  research and innovation;
texts.text: research and innovation;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b)  studies;
texts.text: studies;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c)  corporate affairs and media relations;
texts.text: corporate affairs and media relations;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d)  consultancy; and
texts.text: consultancy; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e)  finance and administration.
texts.text: finance and administration.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Financial Provisions
texts.text: Financial Provisions

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Internal Audit
texts.text: Internal Audit

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 23. The Centre shall have an internal audit unit in accordance with section 83 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921).
texts.text: The Centre shall have an internal audit unit in accordance with section 83 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016 (Act 921).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Funds of the Centre
texts.text: Funds of the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 24. (1) The funds of the Centre shall include:
texts.text: (1) The funds of the Centre shall include:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) moneys approved by Parliament for the Centre;
texts.text: moneys approved by Parliament for the Centre;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) application fees;
texts.text: application fees;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) administrative penalties;
texts.text: administrative penalties;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) any other internally generated funds;
texts.text: any other internally generated funds;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) grants, donations and loans approved by the Minister responsible for Finance; and
texts.text: grants, donations and loans approved by the Minister responsible for Finance; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f) any other moneys approved by the Minister responsible for Finance.
texts.text: any other moneys approved by the Minister responsible for Finance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Budget Estimates
texts.text: Budget Estimates

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 25. The Director-General shall prepare budget estimates for each financial year and present the estimates to the Board for its approval not later than four months prior to the end of the financial year.
texts.text: The Director-General shall prepare budget estimates for each financial year and present the estimates to the Board for its approval not later than four months prior to the end of the financial year.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Bank Account of the Centre
texts.text: Bank Account of the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 26. The moneys for the Centre shall be paid into a bank account opened for the purpose, by the Centre with the approval of the Controller and Accountant-General.
texts.text: The moneys for the Centre shall be paid into a bank account opened for the purpose, by the Centre with the approval of the Controller and Accountant-General.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Borrowing powers of the Centre
texts.text: Borrowing powers of the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 27. Subject to section 76 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016, (Act 921), the Centre may obtain loans and any other credit facilities on the guarantee of the Government from a bank or any other financial institution approved by the Minister responsible for Finance.
texts.text: Subject to section 76 of the Public Financial Management Act, 2016, (Act 921), the Centre may obtain loans and any other credit facilities on the guarantee of the Government from a bank or any other financial institution approved by the Minister responsible for Finance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Expenses of the Centre
texts.text: Expenses of the Centre

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 28. The expenses of the Centre shall be charged on the funds of the Centre.
texts.text: The expenses of the Centre shall be charged on the funds of the Centre.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Accounts and Audit
texts.text: Accounts and Audit

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 29. (1) The Board shall keep books, records, returns and other documents relevant to the accounts in the form approved by the Auditor-General.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall keep books, records, returns and other documents relevant to the accounts in the form approved by the Auditor-General.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The Board shall submit the accounts of the Centre to the Auditor-General for audit at the end of each financial year.
texts.text: The Board shall submit the accounts of the Centre to the Auditor-General for audit at the end of each financial year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The  Auditor-General  shall  within  six  months  after  the  end  of  the  immediately preceding financial year, audit the accounts and forward a copy of the audit report to the Minister and the Board.
texts.text: The  Auditor-General  shall  within  six  months  after  the  end  of  the  immediately preceding financial year, audit the accounts and forward a copy of the audit report to the Minister and the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  The  financial  year  of  the  Centre  shall  be  the  same  as  the  financial  year  of  the Government.
texts.text: The  financial  year  of  the  Centre  shall  be  the  same  as  the  financial  year  of  the Government.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Annual Report and other Reports
texts.text: Annual Report and other Reports

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 30. (1) The Board shall within one month after the receipt of the audit report, submit an annual report to the Minister covering the activities and the operations of the Centre for the year to which the report relates.
texts.text: (1) The Board shall within one month after the receipt of the audit report, submit an annual report to the Minister covering the activities and the operations of the Centre for the year to which the report relates.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The annual report shall include the report of the Auditor-General.
texts.text: The annual report shall include the report of the Auditor-General.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  The Minister shall, within one month after the receipt of the annual report, submit the report  to  Parliament  with  a  statement  that  the  Minister  considers  necessary.  The Board shall submit to the Minister any other reports which the Minister may require in writing.
texts.text: The Minister shall, within one month after the receipt of the annual report, submit the report  to  Parliament  with  a  statement  that  the  Minister  considers  necessary.  The Board shall submit to the Minister any other reports which the Minister may require in writing.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Miscellaneous Provisions
texts.text: Miscellaneous Provisions

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Regulations
texts.text: Regulations

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 31. (1)  The  Minister  on  the  advice  of  the  Centre  may  by  legislative  instrument  make regulations to provide for;
texts.text: (1)  The  Minister  on  the  advice  of  the  Centre  may  by  legislative  instrument  make regulations to provide for;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) forms and supporting documents for applications;
texts.text: forms and supporting documents for applications;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) authorizations;
texts.text: authorizations;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) certification  of  ICT  products  and  technology  solutions  intended  for  research  and development purposes;
texts.text: certification  of  ICT  products  and  technology  solutions  intended  for  research  and development purposes;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) dispute resolution;
texts.text: dispute resolution;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) amendment of the penalties specified in Section 7; and
texts.text: amendment of the penalties specified in Section 7; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f) any other matter necessary for the effective implementation of the provisions of this Act.
texts.text: any other matter necessary for the effective implementation of the provisions of this Act.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Transitional provisions
texts.text: Transitional provisions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 32. (1) A person in the employment of the Centre immediately before the coming into force of  this  Act  shall,  on  the coming into force of this Act, be deemed to have been duly employed by the Centre established under this Act on terms and conditions which are not
texts.text: (1) A person in the employment of the Centre immediately before the coming into force of  this  Act  shall,  on  the coming into force of this Act, be deemed to have been duly employed by the Centre established under this Act on terms and conditions which are not

texts.label: text
texts.orig: less favourable in aggregate to the terms and conditions attached to the post held by the person before the coming into force of this Act.
texts.text: less favourable in aggregate to the terms and conditions attached to the post held by the person before the coming into force of this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)  The assets, rights, obligations and liabilities of the Centre in existence immediately before the coming into force of this Act are transferred to the Centre established under this Act.
texts.text: The assets, rights, obligations and liabilities of the Centre in existence immediately before the coming into force of this Act are transferred to the Centre established under this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)  A  contract  subsisting  between  the  Centre  and  any  other  person  and  in  force immediately before the coming into force of this Act shall subsist between the Centre established under this Act and that other person.
texts.text: A  contract  subsisting  between  the  Centre  and  any  other  person  and  in  force immediately before the coming into force of this Act shall subsist between the Centre established under this Act and that other person.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4)  Any moneys and properties held by or on behalf of the Centre immediately before the coming into force of this Act are transferred to the Centre established under this Act.
texts.text: Any moneys and properties held by or on behalf of the Centre immediately before the coming into force of this Act are transferred to the Centre established under this Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5)  With effect from the coming into force of this Act, the centres, units and the limited liability entities as specified in section 12(2) are centres, units, projects and limited liability entities of the Centre established under this Act.
texts.text: With effect from the coming into force of this Act, the centres, units and the limited liability entities as specified in section 12(2) are centres, units, projects and limited liability entities of the Centre established under this Act.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Interpretation
texts.text: Interpretation

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 33. In this Act unless the context otherwise requires-
texts.text: 33. In this Act unless the context otherwise requires-

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ' Board '  means  the  governing body of the  Kofi Annan  Research and Development Centre.
texts.text: ' Board '  means  the  governing body of the  Kofi Annan  Research and Development Centre.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ' Centre '  means  the Kofi Annan Centre of Excellence in ICT.
texts.text: ' Centre '  means  the Kofi Annan Centre of Excellence in ICT.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Development" means  the  process  of  designing,  improving,  testing,  or  deploying  ICT  as defined,  based  systems,  platforms,  applications,  or  services,  with  the  aim  of  achieving technological,  educational,  social,  or  economic  advancement,  and  includes  activities  that support the practical application or scaling of research and innovation outcomes.
texts.text: "Development" means  the  process  of  designing,  improving,  testing,  or  deploying  ICT  as defined,  based  systems,  platforms,  applications,  or  services,  with  the  aim  of  achieving technological,  educational,  social,  or  economic  advancement,  and  includes  activities  that support the practical application or scaling of research and innovation outcomes.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Entity of a public nature" means any body corporate or unincorporated that meets all of the following criteria:
texts.text: 'Entity of a public nature" means any body corporate or unincorporated that meets all of the following criteria:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) Public  Function:  The  entity  performs  functions  that  are  governmental,  statutory, regulatory,  or  are  otherwise  in  furtherance  of  a  public  mandate  or  public  interest objective;
texts.text: (i) Public  Function:  The  entity  performs  functions  that  are  governmental,  statutory, regulatory,  or  are  otherwise  in  furtherance  of  a  public  mandate  or  public  interest objective;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) Public Control or Oversight: The entity is subject to significant control, supervision, or oversight  by  a  public  authority,  including  the  Government  of  Ghana  or  any  of  its agencies;
texts.text: (ii) Public Control or Oversight: The entity is subject to significant control, supervision, or oversight  by  a  public  authority,  including  the  Government  of  Ghana  or  any  of  its agencies;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iii) Public Funding Dependency: The entity derives a substantial portion of its funding, whether directly or indirectly, from public sources or from funds administered for public purposes;
texts.text: (iii) Public Funding Dependency: The entity derives a substantial portion of its funding, whether directly or indirectly, from public sources or from funds administered for public purposes;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iv) Non-Profit Distribution Constraint: The entity does not operate primarily for profit and is restricted from distributing profits or surpluses to private individuals or shareholders;
texts.text: (iv) Non-Profit Distribution Constraint: The entity does not operate primarily for profit and is restricted from distributing profits or surpluses to private individuals or shareholders;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (v) Accountability:  The  entity  is  subject  to  public  accountability  mechanisms,  such  as statutory reporting requirements, audits by a public auditor, or obligations under public procurement or financial administration laws.
texts.text: (v) Accountability:  The  entity  is  subject  to  public  accountability  mechanisms,  such  as statutory reporting requirements, audits by a public auditor, or obligations under public procurement or financial administration laws.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: An entity shall be deemed not of a public nature if it is privately owned and operated for commercial purposes, and does not satisfy the above criteria.
texts.text: An entity shall be deemed not of a public nature if it is privately owned and operated for commercial purposes, and does not satisfy the above criteria.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "ICT" means  information  and  communication  technology  which  refers  to  all  technologies, systems, infrastructure, software, and platforms used for the collection, processing, storage,
texts.text: "ICT" means  information  and  communication  technology  which  refers  to  all  technologies, systems, infrastructure, software, and platforms used for the collection, processing, storage,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: transmission and dissemination of digital information and electronic communications. For the purposes of this Act, ICT shall include;
texts.text: transmission and dissemination of digital information and electronic communications. For the purposes of this Act, ICT shall include;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) digital hardware and software systems;
texts.text: (i) digital hardware and software systems;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) information systems and digital applications, especially within government operations;
texts.text: (ii) information systems and digital applications, especially within government operations;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iii) data centres, hosting facilities, electronic and cloud-based infrastructure;
texts.text: (iii) data centres, hosting facilities, electronic and cloud-based infrastructure;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iv) digital innovation platforms, and emerging technologies deployed in the public sector; and
texts.text: (iv) digital innovation platforms, and emerging technologies deployed in the public sector; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (v) associated standards, architecture, and interoperability frameworks.
texts.text: (v) associated standards, architecture, and interoperability frameworks.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ' Minister' means the Minister responsible for Communication.
texts.text: ' Minister' means the Minister responsible for Communication.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ' Ministry ' means the Ministry responsible for Communication.
texts.text: ' Ministry ' means the Ministry responsible for Communication.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Public funding' refers to any financial resources, whether in the form of grants, subsidies, investments, loans, or other financial support mechanisms,  allocated, disbursed, or administered, whether by the Government of Ghana or any other party, for the purpose of supporting  research  and  development  in  ICT,  where  the  ultimate  beneficiary  is  the Government of Ghana, any of its ministries, departments, agencies, statutory bodies, or any entity of a public nature.
texts.text: 'Public funding' refers to any financial resources, whether in the form of grants, subsidies, investments, loans, or other financial support mechanisms,  allocated, disbursed, or administered, whether by the Government of Ghana or any other party, for the purpose of supporting  research  and  development  in  ICT,  where  the  ultimate  beneficiary  is  the Government of Ghana, any of its ministries, departments, agencies, statutory bodies, or any entity of a public nature.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Public institutions" refer to government-established, owned, or controlled entities that carry out administrative, regulatory, developmental, or service delivery functions on behalf of the state, excluding public academic institutions. This includes ministries, departments, agencies, statutory bodies, public authorities, and other entities created by or under an Act of Parliament to serve public sector objectives, other than education and academic research conducted by public universities or colleges.
texts.text: "Public institutions" refer to government-established, owned, or controlled entities that carry out administrative, regulatory, developmental, or service delivery functions on behalf of the state, excluding public academic institutions. This includes ministries, departments, agencies, statutory bodies, public authorities, and other entities created by or under an Act of Parliament to serve public sector objectives, other than education and academic research conducted by public universities or colleges.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Research" means  a  systematic  investigation  or  inquiry,  whether  theoretical  or  applied, conducted for the purpose of discovering new knowledge, validating existing knowledge, or generating solutions within the field of ICT, including data collection, analysis, experimentation, design, and evaluation.
texts.text: "Research" means  a  systematic  investigation  or  inquiry,  whether  theoretical  or  applied, conducted for the purpose of discovering new knowledge, validating existing knowledge, or generating solutions within the field of ICT, including data collection, analysis, experimentation, design, and evaluation.
